<add xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" place="margin">
            <l>24<hi rend="superscript">th</hi> Nov</l>
            <l>1940</l>
          </add>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><hi rend="underline">Anon.</hi></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">Introduction</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">"For many centuries after Britain became an island" the</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#gtre" key="Trevelyan, George">historian</rs> says, "the untamed forest was king. " On the matted</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">branches of that forest innumerable birds sang; but</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">that song was heard only by <del>a few</del> <add><del>few</del> a few</add> skin clad hunters in</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>a few</del> <add place="above"><del>the</del></add> <del>clearings</del> an occasional clearing 
            <choice>
              <sic>wld</sic>
              <corr>Would</corr>
            </choice> the</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">desire to sing come to one of those savages because he</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">heard the birds sing? 
            <choice>
              <sic>Wld</sic>
              <corr>Would</corr>
            </choice> he rest his axe against a</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">tree for a moment <del>[illeg.]</del>?</l>

<add xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" place="margin">
            <l><rs>G. M. Trevelyan</rs></l>
            <l>History of</l>
            <l>England p. 3.</l>
          </add>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">The tree was felled. Some [illeg.] hut was made</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">from its branches; & then by degree, the clearing</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">gets larger & larger, the birds fewer & fewer, & the human</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><add place="margin">being</add> sings instead. <add place="above"><del>of [these?]</del></add> The first songs are out of door songs,</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">[spring?] songs, summer songs, winter songs; <del>as they</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">for there was no comfort indoors; <del>no</del> little light, & no</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">books.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">The eye therefore was <del>a</del> much more important to the</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">first singers than to <del>ourselves</del> <add place="above">us</add>. <del>And what did he see?</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><add place="margin">And</add> Some parts of England can still be seen as they saw them –</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>the fens, & the downs.</del> <del>It</del> Now & then, by</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">choosing a view carefully, we [art?] eclipse a chimney or a</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">bungalow we can still see a flat <add place="above">reed whispering <del>weed</del></add> fen <del>where nothing is</del> <add place="above">[illeg.] <del>heavy</del></add></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>[built?]</del>, water logged, or a <del>high</del> down <add>bare</add>; & then <add place="above">the</add></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">a <del>track, like a</del> green scar, & <add place="above">on a</add> some <del>[strang?]</del> smooth</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>circle</del> – the <del>pack horses came along that road</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">the <del>travelling [tithes?]; came along that road; &</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>as time went on</del>, along which the travellers came <add place="above">[ready?]</add> [illeg.]</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">as <del>time went on</del> the skins became <add place="above">were</add> <del>woolen cloaks:</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">were changed to <del>wool</del> cloth; <del>he carried</del> <del>an</del> <del>a dagger</del> <add place="above">the axe to a dagger</add></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">instead of an axe, at last <del>where the</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">instead of a grey rock, <del>to mark</del> <add>to mark by the [illeg.] play, the burial place</add> there was a</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">cross.</l>
